title: Zone Planner
summary: We've added the ability for users to prioritize certain geographical areas while optimizing the route. Users can now create zones in an order of priority they want the drivers to follow while completing the stops. Every zone plan is tied to a specific route, and is completely configurable.
description: • Click on the 'Zone Planner' option in the navigation bar.
• To add a zone, select the route which you want to create a Zone Plan for from the list of routes, then click on the 'Plus' icon and draw a zone on the map by clicking and dragging the cursor.
• Click 'Edit' on the dialog box and set the priorities of each of the zones that were drawn
• Finally, enter the route name that you want to save these zones for and hit Save. Please note that the route name should match exactly for the zones to take effect.

title: Updated location icons
summary: We've added the ability for users to select location icons based on the type of the stop. This will allow users to visually better differentiate between different types of stops. The current version is available for the dispatch console and the plan is to bring this to the app in the next 3-4 weeks.
description:
Details

  • We're currently supporting four variations
    • Residential 
    • Non-residential (aka Businesses)
    • Time Commits
    • High priority
• Users can go to preferences and navigate to 'User Interface' to select the icon pack as well as the individual icon for each type of stop
• We currently have two icon packs and may potentially add/edit a few more icons
• Once an icon is selected for a type of stop, the dispatch console is automatically updated.

title: Custom Geocodes Enhancements
summary: The above enhancements will allow users to further optimize their dispatch and delivery operations based on the types of addresses they are delivering to.
description:
Summary

 

We've further enhanced the ability to add and improve custom location data. The key enhancements include:

  • Attaching address types to an address so that users can better differentiate between residential, office complexes, commercial, and other address types. 
  • Supporting business hours associated with each address type

 

The above enhancements will allow users to further optimize their dispatch and delivery operations based on the types of addresses they are delivering to.

Details

  • Adding address types can be done by selecting an address and clicking  'Modify Geocode'
  • Business hours for an individual address can be added by clicking the edit icon, adding the hours and clicking "Update"
  • Once the data is saved, the stop card will reflect the type of the stop. Future enhancements will include business hours in notes as well as being factored into optimization as well.

title: Live Status > Map
summary: We've updated the functionality of the Map (aka All Stops) view under live status. This will allow users to filter and identify operationally relevant stops faster. The feature applies to all account types but may be most useful for ISPs with Express stops. This will be in production starting 5/24
description:
Summary

We've updated the functionality of the Map (aka All Stops) view under live status. This will allow users to filter and identify operationally relevant stops faster. The feature applies to all account types but may be most useful for ISPs with Express stops. This will be in production starting 5/24

Details

The key changes are
  1. A toggle switch to view/hide stops has been added to the map view (similar to driver and route)
  2. Hovering over the driver's location will show the driver's name and route
  3. Quick Access filters allow you to filter through drivers, routes, and stops. Specifically useful for ISPs with Express Stops
  4. Clicking on Exceptions and Warnings in route metrics summary will take users to the all stops page with the respective stops filtered.

title: Moving Location Pins
summary: To fix any locations on a particular route, you can just drag the pin to the correct location and save it. That will be the new location for that address in the future, across all routes.
description: Step 1: On the map, zoom in to the location of the pin you want to move.
Step 2: Click on the pin until the address information appears, that you would like to move.
Step 3: Move the pin to the desired location. Click “Save.”.

title: How to Turn On Safety Training for Drivers
summary: The tutorial guides you through the process of enrolling drivers in safety training within the Dispatch Console.
description: Step 1: In the Dispatch Console: Settings > Preferences.
Step 2: Choose "Safety."  Click "Turn on safety training."
Step 3: Click Assets > Drivers and Dispatchers.

Step 4: Click the circle with checkmark icon to highlight the entire list of drivers; if an employee does not need the safety training, click on the row of that employee to unhighlight the individual (e.g., a manager who doesn’t deliver).
Step 5: Click "Modify Driver."
Step 6: Check the box "Enroll in Safety Training."  Click "Save."
Step 7: Drivers will be enrolled in safety and you will see a notification under each driver which says "Safety Training is turned on."

title: How to Optimize a Route
summary: The tutorial guides you through the process of optimizing a route by selecting the first stop.
description: Step 1: On the Routes page, click on the desired route number to open the detailed view of the route.
Step 2: Identify the desired first stop and then click the "Optimize Route" button.
Step 3: Use the “Start” dropdown menu, choose "Custom", and type in the address of the first stop.  The address pin will generate; click on the pin to select.
Step 4: Click "Optimize."

title: How to Generate Reports - MMRs
summary: Beans Route makes generating MMR reports simple. Upload a digital signature in your account preferences to have the signature generate on the report. If you have vehicles in multiple warehouses, create vehicle groups so each warehouse can prepare their own MMRs. Best practices include entering maintenance records as you receive them throughout the month and when entering records selecting the actual date of service.
description:
ADD MAINTENANCE RECORDS

Step 1: Click Assets > Vehicles. Click on the vehicle number to open the records.
Step 2: Click the "Add Vehicle Record" button.

Step 3: Select the date of maintenance by clicking on the date line and using the calendar.

NOTE: the date automatically defaults to the current date.  You must select the actual date of maintenance for the MMRs to generate properly.

Step 4: On the "Detail" line fill in the maintenance details. Click "Add Vehicle Record" to save.  Repeat the steps to enter all maintenance records.

NOTE: You can attach maintenance invoices to each record by using the "Attach Files" button.

ADD MILEAGE RECORS (ODOMETER)

Step 1: Click on the vehicle number to open the records.  Click the "Add Vehicle Record" button.

Step 2: For "Type" use the dropdown menu to select "Odometer."

Step 3: For "Date" use the calendar to change the date to the last day of the previous month.

NOTE: the date automatically defaults to the current date.  You must change the date for odometer readings to the last day of the previous month for the MMRs to generate properly.
Step 4: Enter the mileage on the "Details" line.  Click "Add Vehicle Record" to save.  Repeat the steps to enter all mileage records.

OUT OF SERVICE

Step 1: If you have a vehicle which is out of service, click on the vehicle number to open the records.

Step 2: Click the "Modify Vehicle" button.
Step 3: Change the "Status" from "active" to "out of service" and click save.

GENERATE MMR REPORTS

Step 1: Select the vehicles you wish to generate MMRs reports for by clicking on the row to highlight; to select all vehicles, click the "select all" icon above the list (circle with a checkmark).

NOTE: If the "Active" filter is on, any vehicles marked "out of service" will not show in the list.  To see all vehicles, including those out of service, simply click the "x" on the "Active filter."  MMRs will not be generated for vehicles marked "out of service."
Step 2: Click the "Generate Report" button.

Step 3: Select the dates for the report.

NOTE: The month automatically defaults to the previous month.  If you need to generate MMR reports for past months, simply click on the month line and select the appropriate month.  The report date automatically defaults to the current date; you can adjust the date by clicking on the report date line and using the calendar to select the desired date.
Step 4: Click the "Generate Report" button.
Step 5: The MMRs will be generated in PDF format.  Click the link to view the MMRs to print or to download and email to your terminal.
